question: Which oil company has rolled out special winter-grade diesel for Ladakh ?
explanation: The Indian Oil Corporation (IOCL) has launched a special winter-grade diesel for high altitude regions such as Ladakh, Kargil, Kaza and Keylong. This unique winter-grade fuel has been engineered to perform in extremely cold weather conditions. It will help provide year-round access to grueling regions and will work as a catalyst in the country\'s efforts to speed up strategic road connectivity. This special fuel produced by Panipat refinery is capable of remaining unfrozen up to minus 33 degree Celsius. It also meets BIS specification of BS-VI grade diesel.
